block.p: Two agencies owned by the Interpublic Group of Companies have made top appointments at their New York operations.

Sean Cunningham was named executive vice president and media director for the New York operations of Universal McCann, the media agency that is part of the McCann-Erickson World Group. He succeeds Mark Stewart, who remains executive vice president and North American media director. Mr. Cunningham, 39, had been executive vice president and media director at the New York office of a sibling agency, Lowe Lintas & Partners Worldwide, which is part of the Lowe Group unit of Interpublic.

Mr. Cunningham, 39, had been executive vice president and media director at the New York office of a sibling agency, Lowe Lintas & Partners Worldwide, which is part of the Lowe Group unit of Interpublic.

And Nils Peyron was named to the new post of managing director at the New York office of Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos, responsible for operations and business development. He will work with David Wecal, who is president and chief creative officer of the office.

Mr. Peyron, 42, assumes some duties that had been handled by Chuck Kushell, who served as president of the office until leaving in March to head his own Internet consulting agency. Mr. Peyron had been a senior partner and executive group director at the New York office of Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide, part of the WPP Group.
